Pizza Ordering System

API Reference

This section provides detailed information about the classes and methods in the Pizza Ordering System.

Order Module

class src.order.Order[source]

Bases: object

Order class for managing customer pizza orders.

This class handles the creation and management of customer orders, including adding pizzas, calculating total cost, and processing payment.

pizzas

List of Pizza objects in the order

Type:

list

cost

Total cost of the order

Type:

int

paid

Payment status of the order

Type:

bool

Example

>>> order = Order()
>>> order.input_pizza("thin", ["marinara"], "mozzarella", ["pepperoni"])
>>> print(order)
Your order:
1. Thin crust pizza with marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and pepperoni. Cost: $9

Total cost: $9 (NOT PAID)

__init__()[source]

Initialize a customer order with empty pizza list and zero cost.

The order starts with no pizzas, zero cost, and is marked as not paid.

Example

>>> order = Order()
>>> len(order.pizzas)
0
>>> order.cost
0
>>> order.paid
False
__str__()[source]

Return a string representation of the complete order.

Returns:

Description of all pizzas in the order and total cost

Return type:

str

Example

>>> order = Order()
>>> order.input_pizza("thin", ["marinara"], "mozzarella", ["pepperoni"])
>>> print(order)
Your order:
1. Thin crust pizza with marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and pepperoni. Cost: $9

Total cost: $9 (NOT PAID)

input_pizza(crust, sauce, cheese, toppings)[source]

Add a pizza to the order.

This method creates a new Pizza object with the specified ingredients and adds it to the order, updating the total cost.

Parameters:

  • crust (str) – Type of crust

  • sauce (list) – List of sauces

  • cheese (str) – Type of cheese

  • toppings (list) – List of toppings

Example

>>> order = Order()
>>> order.input_pizza("thin", ["marinara"], "mozzarella", ["pepperoni"])
>>> len(order.pizzas)
1
>>> order.cost
9
order_paid()[source]

Mark the order as paid.

This method updates the payment status of the order to indicate that payment has been received.

Example

>>> order = Order()
>>> order.input_pizza("thin", ["marinara"], "mozzarella", ["pepperoni"])
>>> order.paid
False
>>> order.order_paid()
>>> order.paid
True

Pizza Module

class src.pizza.Pizza(crust, sauce, cheese, toppings)[source]

Bases: object

Pizza class for creating and managing pizza objects.

This class handles the creation of pizza objects with various ingredients and calculates the cost based on the selected options.

crust

Type of crust (thin, thick, or gluten_free)

Type:

str

sauce

List of sauces (marinara, pesto, liv_sauce)

Type:

list

cheese

Type of cheese (only mozzarella supported)

Type:

str

toppings

List of toppings (pineapple, pepperoni, mushrooms)

Type:

list

Example

>>> pizza = Pizza("thin", ["marinara"], "mozzarella", ["pepperoni"])
>>> print(pizza)
Thin crust pizza with marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and pepperoni. Cost: $9
CRUST_PRICES = {'gluten_free': 8, 'thick': 6, 'thin': 5}
SAUCE_PRICES = {'liv_sauce': 5, 'marinara': 2, 'pesto': 3}
TOPPING_PRICES = {'mushrooms': 3, 'pepperoni': 2, 'pineapple': 1}
__init__(crust, sauce, cheese, toppings)[source]

Initialize a pizza with specified ingredients.

Parameters:

  • crust (str) – Type of crust (thin, thick, or gluten_free)

  • sauce (list) – List of sauces (marinara, pesto, liv_sauce)

  • cheese (str) – Type of cheese (only mozzarella supported)

  • toppings (list) – List of toppings (pineapple, pepperoni, mushrooms)

Raises:

ValueError – If any ingredient is invalid or if required ingredients are missing

Example

>>> pizza = Pizza("thin", ["marinara"], "mozzarella", ["pepperoni"])
__str__()[source]

Return a string representation of the pizza.

Returns:

Description of the pizza and its cost

Return type:

str

Example

>>> pizza = Pizza("thin", ["marinara"], "mozzarella", ["pepperoni"])
>>> str(pizza)
'Thin crust pizza with marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and pepperoni. Cost: $9'
cost()[source]

Calculate the cost of the pizza based on its ingredients.

The cost is calculated by adding: - The cost of the crust - The cost of each sauce - The cost of each topping

Returns:

Total cost of the pizza

Return type:

int

Example

>>> pizza = Pizza("thin", ["marinara"], "mozzarella", ["pepperoni"])
>>> pizza.cost()
9
